meanings.sent1: She was swiling the dishes in the sink.
meanings.sent2: The chef is swiling the vegetables before cooking.
meanings.sent3: After swiling the car, it looked sparkling clean.
meanings.sent4: The rain was swiling down the windowpane all night.
meanings.sent5: The river swiling over the rocks sounded soothing.

meanings.definition: Swiling: The act of washing or rinsing with a swill
meanings.sent1: The swiling of the clothes was done by hand.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the swiling of the dishes in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The swiling of the floor made it slippery but clean.
meanings.sent4: The swiling of the car with a hose was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The swiling of the windows made them crystal clear.

meanings.definition: Swiling: To wash or rinse with a swill
meanings.sent1: He swiled the muddy boots before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: The farmer swiling the pigs in the pen.
meanings.sent3: She swiled her face with cold water to wake up.
meanings.sent4: The waves swiling the shore left behind treasures.
meanings.sent5: The wind swiling through the trees created a calming sound.
